TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AddInAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class AddInAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class AddInAttribute sealed : Attribute

Docs.summary: Identifies an object as an add-in.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following methods, which maintain the store of information about available pipeline segments, use this attribute to identify an add-in.
- <xref:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.Rebuild%2A>
- <xref:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.RebuildAddIns%2A>
- <xref:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.Update%2A>
- <xref:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.UpdateAddIns%2A>
- <xref:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.FindAddIn%2A>
This attribute is not required when an add-in is found exclusively by the <xref:System.AddIn.Hosting.AddInStore.FindAddIn%2A> method. The host has already identified the add-in by its type name and location, and therefore the attribute is not required for the add-in to be discovered.
This attribute should be used only on types that activate the segments of the pipeline. Types that represent objects passed between the host and the add-in do not need this attribute.
## Examples The following example identifies an add-in.
[!code-csharp[AddInP2AddInCalcV2#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/AddInP2AddInCalcV2/cs/addincalcv2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[AddInP2AddInCalcV2#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/AddInP2AddInCalcV2/vb/AddInCalcV2.vb#2)]
